title: More than 100 jobs lost as Devon family bakery shuts
title_page: More than 100 jobs lost as Devon family bakery shuts - BBC News
maintext:
A family run bakery in Exeter has shut, leaving more than 100 people out of work, its owners confirmed.
Crusty Cob has been in operation for 55 years with four generations of the Tubbs family.
The Tubbs family cited rising costs and fewer customers for the closure.
The company had nine outlets in both Devon and Somerset and supplied other stores with its products.
The firm shut its doors on Tuesday and staff were praised for their "hard work and dedication".
In a statement, the Tubbs family said: "The current state of bakery manufacturing, a shrinking customer base in the High Street, inflation, energy costs along with wage and National Insurance increases have all contributed to this decision.
"Moreover, our industry has been in a constant downturn, making it increasingly difficult to sustain our business."
